title: [Large-scale] Digital Systems Foundations Education: Integrated Active and Flipped Learning Course

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of electronics and computer architecture
context.additional_context: Learners access online course materials via personal devices (BYOD) and engage in active learning during in-person sessions, with project-based assessments emphasizing real-world problem-solving skills

learning_goals: Learners can explain the basic components and operational principles of digital logic circuits.
Learners autonomously acquire digital system design concepts using flipped learning video materials.
Learners analyze real-world applications of digital systems through team-based problem-solving activities during face-to-face sessions.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
